feat.name: Aberrant Dragonmark
entries: 你已经显现了一个异常的龙纹。确定它的外观和与之相关的缺陷。你获得以下好处。

items: 你学会了一个{@filter cantrip of your choice from the sorcerer spell list|spells|level=0|class=Sorcerer}。此外，选择一个（%1%）。你学会了那个法术，并且可以通过你的标记施放它。一旦你施放了它，你必须完成一个短期或长期的休息，然后才能通过标记再次施放它。体质是你对这些法术的施法能力。
当你通过你的标记施展一级法术时，你可以消耗你的一个命中率骰子并进行滚动。如果你掷的是偶数，你会获得与掷出的数字相等的临时命中率。如果你掷出的是奇数，你周围30英尺内的一个随机生物（不包括你）会受到与掷出的数字相等的力量伤害。如果没有其他生物在范围内，你会受到伤害。

entries: 你还会从异端龙纹缺陷表中随机产生一个缺陷。

entries.caption: Aberrant Dragonmark Flaws
rows: 你的印记是身体持续疼痛的来源。
你的标记对你耳语。它的含义可能并不明确。
当你有压力时，这个标记会发出响亮的嘶嘶声。
印记周围的皮肤被烧伤，有鳞片，或枯萎。
动物在你身边感到不安。
你在使用你的标记时都会有情绪波动。
每当你使用这个标记时，你的容貌就会发生轻微的变化。
在你使用你的标记后，你会做可怕的恶梦。

entries.name: Option: Greater Aberrant Powers
entries: 根据DM的选择，拥有异端龙印特技的角色有机会表现出更大的力量。在达到10级时，这样的角色有{@chance 10|10 percent}的机会从第七章的选项中获得{@filter epic boon|rewards|type=boon}的{@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}。如果该角色未能获得恩赐，他们在下次获得等级时有{@chance 10|10 percent}的机会。
如果这个角色获得了一个好处，DM会选择它或随机确定它。该角色也会永久地失去他们的一个命中率，他们的最大命中率会减少，减少的量等于掷出的那个骰子加上他们的宪法修改器（最小减少量为1）。这种减少是无法通过任何方式逆转的。

feat.name: Acrobat
entries: 你变得更加灵活，获得了以下好处。

items: 你获得对{@skill Acrobatics}技能的熟练度。如果你已经精通该技能，你在使用该技能进行检查时将获得双倍的精通奖励。
作为奖励动作，你可以进行DC15的灵巧（（%0%））检查。如果你成功了，{@quickref difficult terrain||3}在当前回合结束前不会让你付出额外的行动。

feat.name: Actor
entries: 擅长模仿和戏剧表演，你获得以下好处。

items: 当你试图把自己伪装成另一个人时，你在魅力（（%0%））和魅力（（%1%））的检查中具有优势。
你可以模仿另一个人的讲话或其他生物发出的声音。你必须听到那个人说话，或者听到那个生物发出的声音，至少有1分钟。智慧（（%0%））检查成功后，通过你的魅力（（%1%））检查，听众可以确定该效果是伪造的。

feat.name: Adept of the Black Robes

feat: initiate of high sorcery|dsotdq|initiate of high sorcery (nuitari)

entries: 你选择了月亮Nuitari来影响你的魔法，你的野心和对黑袍会的忠诚得到了认可，赋予你这些好处。

items.name: Ambitious Magic
entries: 你学习一个你选择的二阶法术。该{@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=E;N}必须是来自魔法学派或死灵学派的魔法。你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的二阶法术，在你再次以这种方式施放之前，你必须完成一次长时间的休息。你也可以使用你所拥有的相应等级的法术槽来施放此法术。该法术的施法能力是你获得{@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|DSotDQ}特技时选择的。

items.name: Life Channel
entries: 你可以将你的生命力转化为你的魔法的力量。当你能看到的60英尺范围内的生物对你施放的造成伤害的法术的蓄力失败时，你可以消耗与该法术等级相等的命中率点数。滚动消耗的命中率并将它们加在一起。该生物所受的伤害会增加，其数量等于该总数。

feat.name: Adept of the Black Robes
entries: 你的野心和对黑袍会的忠诚得到了认可，给予你这些好处。

items.name: Ambitious Magic
entries: 你学习一个你选择的二阶法术。该{@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=V;N}必须是来自唤醒或亡灵魔法学派。你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的二阶法术，你必须在完成一个长时间的休息后才能再次以这种方式施放它。你也可以使用你所拥有的相应等级的法术槽来施放此法术。该法术的施法能力是你获得{@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|UA2022HeroesOfKrynn}特技时选择的。

items.name: Life Channel
entries: 你可以将你的生命力转化为你的魔法的力量。当你能看到的60英尺范围内的生物对你施放的法术的蓄力失败时，你可以消耗与该法术等级相等的命中率点数。掷出与所消耗的命中率一半相等的命中率骰子（四舍五入），触发的生物所受的伤害会增加，其数量与这些骰子的总掷出量相等。

feat.name: Adept of the Black Robes
entries: 你选择了月亮Nuitari来影响你的魔法，你的野心和对黑袍会的忠诚得到了认可，赋予你这些好处。

items.name: Ambitious Magic
entries: 你学习一个你选择的二阶法术。该{@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=E;N}必须是来自魔法学派或死灵学派的魔法。你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的二阶法术，在你再次以这种方式施放之前，你必须完成一次长时间的休息。你也可以使用你所拥有的相应等级的法术槽来施放此法术。该法术的施法能力是你获得{@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|UA2022HeroesOfKrynnRevisited}特技时选择的。

items.name: Life Channel
entries: 你可以将你的生命力转化为你的魔法的力量。当你能看到的60英尺范围内的生物对你施放的造成伤害的法术的蓄力失败时，你可以消耗与该法术等级相等的命中率。滚动消耗的命中率并将它们加在一起。该生物所受的伤害会增加，其数量等于该总数。

feat.name: Adept of the Red Robes

feat: initiate of high sorcery|dsotdq|initiate of high sorcery (lunitari)

entries: 你选择了月亮Lunitari来影响你的魔法，你对维持万物平衡的奉献得到了红袍会的认可，给予你这些好处。

items.name: Insightful Magic
entries: 你学习一个你选择的二阶法术。该{@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=I;T}必须是来自幻术或转化术的魔法流派。你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的二阶法术，在你再次以这种方式施放之前，你必须完成一次长时间的休息。你也可以使用你所拥有的相应等级的法术槽来施放此法术。该法术的施法能力是你获得{@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|DSotDQ}特技时选择的。

items.name: Magical Balance
entries: 当你做一个攻击卷或能力检查，并在（%0%）上掷出9或更低的分数时，你可以平衡命运并将该卷视为10。你可以用这种方式平衡命运，次数与你的熟练度加成相等，当你完成一个长时间的休息时，你会恢复所有消耗的使用。

feat.name: Adept of the Red Robes
entries: 你对真理的追求和对维护万物平衡的奉献，得到了红袍会的认可，给予你这些好处。

items.name: Insightful Magic
entries: 你学习一个你选择的二阶法术。该{@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=D;T}必须是来自占卜或转化魔法学派。你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的二阶法术，你必须在完成一个长时间的休息后才能再次以这种方式施放它。你也可以使用你所拥有的相应等级的法术槽来施放此法术。该法术的施法能力是你获得{@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|UA2022HeroesOfKrynn}特技时选择的。

items.name: Magical Balance
entries: 当你进行攻击卷、能力检查或蓄力投掷时，如果在（%0%）上掷出9或更低的分数，你可以使用你的反应来平衡命运，并将该卷视为10。你可以使用这个反应的次数与你的熟练度加成相等，当你完成一个长时间的休息时，你会恢复所有消耗的使用。

feat.name: Adept of the Red Robes
entries: 你选择了月亮Lunitari来影响你的魔法，你对维持万物平衡的奉献得到了红袍会的认可，给予你这些好处。

items.name: Insightful Magic
entries: 你学习一个你选择的二阶法术。该{@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=I;T}必须是来自幻术或转化术的魔法流派。你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的二阶法术，在你再次以这种方式施放之前，你必须完成一次长时间的休息。你也可以使用你所拥有的相应等级的法术槽来施放此法术。该法术的施法能力是你获得{@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|UA2022HeroesOfKrynnRevisited}特技时选择的。

items.name: Magical Balance
entries: 当你做一个攻击卷或能力检查，并在（%0%）上掷出9或更低的分数时，你可以平衡命运并将该卷视为10。你可以用这种方式平衡命运，次数与你的熟练度加成相等，当你完成一个长时间的休息时，你会恢复所有消耗的使用。

feat.name: Adept of the White Robes

feat: initiate of high sorcery|dsotdq|initiate of high sorcery (solinari)

entries: 你选择了月亮Solinari来影响你的魔法，而你使用魔法使世界变得更美好的誓言也得到了白袍会的认可，赋予你这些好处。

items.name: Protective Magic
entries: 你学习一个你选择的2级法术。该{@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=A;D}必须来自咒语或占卜学派的魔法。你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的二阶法术，你必须在完成一个长时间的休息后才能再次以这种方式施放它。你也可以使用你所拥有的相应等级的法术槽来施放此法术。该法术的施法能力是你获得{@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|DSotDQ}特技时选择的。

items.name: Protective Ward
entries: 当你或你能看到的30英尺范围内的生物受到伤害时，你可以用你的反应来消耗一个法术槽，在目标周围编织保护性魔法。掷出与所消耗的法术槽等级相等的骰子数量，并将目标受到的伤害减少到这些骰子所掷出的总数+你的法术能力修改值。

feat.name: Adept of the White Robes
entries: 你使用魔法使世界变得更美好的誓言得到了白袍骑士团的认可，赋予了你这些好处。

items.name: Protective Magic
entries: 你学习一个你选择的二阶法术。该{@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=A;C}法术必须来自咒语学派或法术学派。你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的二阶法术，你必须在完成一个长时间的休息后才能再次以这种方式施放它。你也可以使用你所拥有的相应等级的法术槽来施放此法术。该法术的施法能力是你获得{@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|UA2022HeroesOfKrynn}特技时选择的。

items.name: Protective Ward
entries: 当你或你能看到的30英尺内的生物受到伤害时，你可以用你的反应来消耗一个法术槽，在目标周围编织保护性魔法。掷出与所消耗的法术槽等级相等的数个d4，并以这些骰子所掷的总数+你的法术能力修饰值减少目标所受的伤害。

feat.name: Adept of the White Robes
entries: 你选择了月亮Solinari来影响你的魔法，而你使用魔法使世界变得更美好的誓言也得到了白袍会的认可，赋予你这些好处。

items.name: Protective Magic
entries: 你学习一个你选择的2级法术。该{@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=A;D}必须来自咒语或占卜学派的魔法。你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的二阶法术，你必须在完成一个长时间的休息后才能再次以这种方式施放它。你也可以使用你所拥有的相应等级的法术槽来施放此法术。该法术的施法能力是你获得{@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|UA2022HeroesOfKrynnRevisited}特技时选择的。

items.name: Protective Ward
entries: 当你或你能看到的30英尺范围内的生物受到伤害时，你可以用你的反应来消耗一个法术槽，在目标周围编织保护性魔法。掷出与所消耗的法术槽等级相等的骰子数量，并将目标受到的伤害减少到这些骰子所掷出的总数+你的法术能力修改值。

feat.name: Agent Of Order

feat: scion of the outer planes|ua2022wondersofthemultiverse|scion of the outer planes (lawful outer plane)

entries: 你可以引导宇宙的秩序力量，将多元宇宙锁定为模式。你的行动是你自己选择的，但这些力量赋予你以下好处。

items.name: Stasis Strike
entries: 每回合一次，当你对自己60英尺范围内的生物造成伤害时，你可以对目标造成额外的{@damage 1d8}武力伤害，而且它必须在智慧救赎中成功（DC等于8+你的熟练度加成+本壮举所增加的能力分数的修正值），或者被{@condition restrained}幽灵束缚，直到你下一回合开始。这些束缚表现为链子、齿轮、包裹的石头或其他一些停滞的符号。你可以使用的次数与你的熟练度加成相等，当你完成一个长时间的休息时，你会恢复所有已消耗的使用。

feat.name: Alchemist
entries: 你研究过炼金术的秘密，是炼金术的专家，获得了以下好处。

items: 你获得对（%0%）的熟练度。如果你已经精通它们，你会在使用它们进行检查时增加双倍的精通度。
作为一项行动，你可以在你5英尺范围内识别一种药水，就像你尝过它一样。你必须看到液体，这个好处才会起作用。
在任何短暂的休息过程中，你可以暂时提高一种{@item potion of healing}的任何稀有物的效力。要使用这个好处，你必须带着（%1%），而且药水必须在你的手边。如果在短时休息结束后不超过1小时内喝下药水，喝下药水的生物可以放弃药水的掷骰子，并恢复药水所能恢复的最大命中数。

feat.name: Alert
entries: 始终保持对危险的警惕，你会获得以下好处。

items: 你获得一个+5的主动性奖励。
在你有意识的时候，你不可能是（%0%）。
其他生物不会因为不被你看见而在对你的攻击卷中获得优势。

feat.name: Animal Handler
entries: 你掌握了训练和处理动物所需的技术。你获得以下好处。

items: 你获得对{@skill Animal Handling}技能的熟练度。如果你已经精通该技能，你在使用该技能进行检查时将获得双倍的精通奖励。
你可以在你的回合中使用一个额外的行动来指挥你60英尺范围内的一只友好的野兽，该野兽可以听到你的声音，并且目前没有听从其他人的指挥。你现在就决定该野兽在下一回合将采取什么行动，以及它将在哪里移动，或者你发出一个持续1分钟的一般命令，例如守卫一个特定区域。

feat.name: Arcanist
entries: 你学习奥术，获得以下好处。

items: 你获得对{@skill Arcana}技能的熟练度。如果你已经精通该技能，你在使用该技能进行检查时将获得双倍的精通奖励。
你学会了（%0%）和（%1%）的法术。你可以在不消耗法术槽的情况下施放（%2%）一次，当你完成长时间休息时，你会重新获得施放能力。

feat.name: Artificer Initiate
entries: 你已经学会了一些工匠的发明能力。

items: 你从（%0%）中学习一个你选择的咒语，你从（%1%）中学习一个你选择的一级法术。智力是你对这些法术的施法能力。
你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的一级法术，在你再次以这种方式施放之前，你必须完成一次长时间的休息。你也可以使用你拥有的任何法术槽来施放该法术。
你获得对你选择的一种（%0%）工具的熟练度，并且你可以将这种类型的工具作为你施展的任何以智力为施法能力的法术的施法重点。

feat.name: Artificer Initiate
entries: 你已经学会了一些工匠的发明能力，使你获得以下好处。

items: 你从（%0%）中学习一个你选择的咒语，你从（%1%）中学习一个你选择的一级法术。智力是你对这些法术的施法能力。每当你获得一个等级，你可以从工匠法术列表中用另一个同等级的法术来替换其中一个法术。
你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的一级法术，在你再次以这种方式施放之前，你必须完成一次长时间的休息。你也可以使用你拥有的任何法术槽来施放该法术。
你获得对你所选择的一种（%0%）工具的熟练度，并且你可以将这种类型的工具作为你施展的任何以智力为法术能力的法术的重点。

feat.name: Athlete
entries: 你经历了大量的体能训练，获得了以下好处。

items: 当你是{@condition prone}时，站起来只用5英尺的移动距离。
攀登并不花费你的额外移动。
你可以在步行时只移动5英尺，而不是10英尺后进行跑步跳远或跑步跳高。

feat.name: Baleful Scion

feat: scion of the outer planes|ua2022wondersofthemultiverse|scion of the outer planes (evil outer plane)

entries: 你可以引导宇宙中的邪恶力量，这些力量会造成痛苦，但会振奋你的存在。尽管有这种恶性联系，你仍能选择自己的行动。你获得以下好处。

items.name: Life-Draining Grasp
entries: 每回合一次，当你用近战武器攻击击中一个生物时，你也可以对它造成坏死的伤害。该伤害等于（%0%）+你的熟练度加成，并且你恢复的命中率与所造成的坏死伤害相等。你可以使用这个功能的次数等于你的熟练度加成，当你完成一个长时间的休息时，你会恢复所有消耗的使用。

feat.name: Barbed Hide
entries: 你的一个祖先是一个带刺的魔鬼或其他带刺的恶魔。倒刺从你的头上伸出来。你获得以下好处。

items: 作为一个额外的动作，你可以使小倒刺突出你的全身，或使它们缩回。在倒钩伸出的每个回合开始时，你对任何抓捕你的生物或你身边的任何生物造成{@damage 1d6}的穿刺伤害。
你获得对{@skill Intimidation}技能的熟练度。如果你已经精通该技能，你在使用该技能进行检查时将获得双倍的精通奖励。

feat.name: Blade Mastery
entries: 你掌握了（%0%）、（%1%）、（%2%）、（%3%）和（%4%）。使用其中任何一种时，你都能获得以下好处。

items: 你在使用该武器进行攻击时获得+1的奖励。
在你的回合中，你可以使用你的反应来做出招架的姿势，只要你手上有武器。这样做会使你的攻击力获得+1的加成，直到你下一回合开始或你不持有武器为止。
当你用该武器进行机会攻击时，你在攻击卷上有优势。

feat.name: Bountiful Luck
entries: 每当你能看到的30英尺内的盟友在攻击卷、能力检定或蓄力投掷上掷出1时，你可以使用你的反应让盟友重新掷出骰子。该盟友必须使用新卷。

feat.name: Bountiful Luck
entries: 你的人民有非凡的运气，当你看到你的同伴动摇时，你已经学会将其神秘地借给他们。你不确定你是如何做到的；你只是希望它，它就会发生。这当然是财富青睐的标志!
当你能看到的30英尺范围内的盟友在攻击卷、能力检定或蓄力投掷上掷出1时，你可以使用你的反应让盟友重新掷出骰子。该盟友必须使用新卷。
当你使用这个能力时，你在下一回合结束前不能使用你的幸运种族特质。

feat.name: Brawny
entries: 你变得更加强大，获得以下好处。

items: 你获得对{@skill Athletics}技能的熟练度。如果你已经精通该技能，你在使用该技能进行检查时将获得双倍的精通奖励。
在确定你的运载能力时，你就像大一码一样计算。

feat.name: Burglar
entries: 你为自己的敏捷和对某些秘密活动的密切研究感到自豪。你获得以下好处。

items: 你获得对（%0%）的熟练度。如果你已经精通它们，你会在使用它们进行检查时增加双倍的精通度。

feat.name: Cartomancer
entries: 你已经学会通过一副扑克牌引导你的魔法，赋予你这些好处。

items.name: Card Focus
entries: 你可以使用一副牌作为你的施法焦点。当你用这副牌作为焦点来施展一个造成伤害的法术时，要掷出一个（%0%）。你在该法术的一个伤害卷上获得与所掷数字相等的奖励。这个奖励适用于你选择的一个被法术伤害的生物；你可以使用这个好处的次数等于你的熟练度奖励，当你完成一个长时间的休息时，你会恢复所有消耗的使用。

items.name: Card Tricks
entries: 你学会了{@spell prestidigitation}的咒语，并能用它来创造复制舞台魔法效果的幻觉。当你以这种方式使用预知术时，你可以将咒语中的语言和肢体部分掩盖为普通的对话和卡片处理。

items.name: Hidden Ace
entries: 当你完成一个长时间的休息时，你可以选择一个你所知道的法术，并将其灌输到一张卡片上；所选择的法术必须有一个行动的施法时间，而且其等级必须小于或等于你的熟练度奖励。当卡牌被注入咒语时，你可以使用你的额外行动使卡牌发亮并施放其中的咒语。然后卡片会立即失去魔力。

feat.name: Charger
entries: 当你使用你的行动来（%0%），你可以使用一个额外的行动来进行一次近战武器攻击或对一个生物进行（%1%）。
如果你在采取这个奖励行动之前立即在一条直线上移动至少10英尺，你要么在攻击的伤害卷上获得+5的奖励（如果你选择进行近战攻击并击中），要么将目标推离你最多10英尺（如果你选择推搡并且成功）。

feat.name: Chef
entries: 掌握烹饪艺术的时间得到了回报，赋予了你以下的好处。

items: 如果你还没有熟练掌握，你将获得（%0%）的熟练度。
作为短暂休息的一部分，你可以烹饪特殊的食物，只要你手上有原料和（%0%）。你可以为等于4+你熟练度加成的生物准备足够多的这种食物。在短时休息结束时，任何吃了食物并花了一个或多个命中率骰子来恢复命中率的生物都会重新获得额外的（%1%）命中率。
通过一小时的工作或完成长时间的休息，你可以烹制与你的熟练度奖励相等数量的食物。这些特殊的食物在制作后可以持续8小时。一个生物可以使用一个额外的行动来吃其中的一个，以获得与你的熟练度加成相等的临时命中率。

feat.name: Chef
entries: 掌握烹饪艺术所花费的时间和精力得到了回报。你获得了以下好处。

items: 如果你还没有熟练掌握，你将获得（%0%）的熟练度。
作为短暂休息的一部分，你可以烹饪特殊的食物，只要你手上有原料和（%0%）。你可以为等于4+你熟练度加成的生物准备足够多的这种食物。在短时休息结束时，任何吃了食物并花了一个或多个命中率骰子来恢复命中率的生物都会重新获得额外的（%1%）命中率。
通过一小时的工作或完成长时间的休息，你可以烹制与你的熟练度奖励相等数量的食物。这些特殊的食物在制作后可以持续8小时。一个生物可以使用一个额外的行动来吃其中的一个，以获得与你的熟练度加成相等的临时命中率。

feat.name: Cohort Of Chaos

feat: scion of the outer planes|ua2022wondersofthemultiverse|scion of the outer planes (chaotic outer plane)

entries: 你可以引导宇宙的混乱力量，推动多元宇宙走向自由和混乱。你的行动仍然由你自己选择，但你获得了这些好处。

items.name: Chaotic Flare
entries: 当你在攻击卷或蓄力卷上掷出1或20时，混乱的魔力会流经你。在混沌光环表上滚动以决定发生什么。一个信号弹会持续到你的下一个回合结束，在第一个信号弹结束后才会有新的信号弹出现。

entries.caption: Chaotic Flares
rows: {@b Disruption Field.}能量波在以你为中心的10英尺范围内产生涟漪。除你以外的每个生物在该区域开始其回合，或在一个回合中第一次移动到该区域，都会受到{@dice 1d8}武力伤害。
{@b Battle Fury.} 你选择的一个你能看到的生物充满了鲁莽的愤怒。该生物在攻击卷上有优势，在能力检查上有劣势。
{@b Unbound.}当你移动时，你可以使用你的部分或全部行走速度来传送一次，连同你所穿戴或携带的任何装备，最多使用的距离是一个你能看到的未被占用的空间。
{@b Wailing Winds.} 咆哮的狂风在你周围60英尺的范围内旋转。你和该半径内的任何生物在智慧救赎上都处于劣势。

entries: 你也可以强行释放一个混乱信号弹作为奖励动作，像平常一样在桌上滚动来决定效果。你可以使用这个额外动作的次数与你的熟练度加成相等，当你完成一个长时间的休息时，你会恢复所有已消耗的使用。

feat.name: Critter Friend
entries: 你与动物的友谊神秘地加深了。你获得以下好处。

items: 你获得对{@skill Animal Handling}技能的熟练度。如果你已经精通该技能，你在使用该技能进行检查时将获得双倍的精通奖励。
你学会了{@spell speak with animals}的法术，并且可以随意施放，无需消耗一个法术槽。你也学会了{@spell animal friendship}的法术，你可以用这个特技施放它一次，而不需要消耗一个法术槽。当你完成一次长时间的休息时，你会重新获得以这种方式施展的能力。智力是你对这些法术的施法能力。

feat.name: Crossbow Expert
entries: 由于广泛地练习了十字弓，你获得了以下好处。

items: 你忽略了你所精通的十字弓的装载质量。
在敌对生物的5英尺范围内，不会对你的远程攻击卷轴造成不利影响。
当你使用（%0%）动作并以单手武器攻击时，你可以使用一个额外的动作，以你所持有的（%1%）进行攻击。

feat.name: Cruel
entries: The challenges and struggles you've faced throughout your life have led you to delight in inflicting pain and anguish upon others. You gain a number of cruelty dice equal to your proficiency bonus. Your cruelty dice are {@dice d6|d6s}. You can roll only one cruelty die per turn, and a cruelty die is spent when you roll it.
You can roll a cruelty die under any of the following circumstances, with the indicated result:

items: When you deal damage to a creature, spend one cruelty die to deal extra damage to the creature equal to the roll.
When you score a critical hit, spend one cruelty die to gain temporary hit points equal to the roll.
When you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check, spend one cruelty die and add the roll to your check.

entries: You regain all spent cruelty dice when you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

feat.name: Crusher
entries: You are practiced in the art of crushing your enemies, granting you the following benefits:

items: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.
When you score a critical hit that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with advantage until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Crusher
entries: You are practiced in the art of crushing your enemies, granting you the following benefits:

items: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.
When you score a critical hit that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with advantage until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Defensive Duelist
entries: When you are wielding a finesse weapon with which you are proficient and another creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

feat.name: Diplomat
entries: You master the arts of diplomacy, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

If you spend 1 minute talking to someone who can understand what you say, you can make a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check contested by the creature's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If you or your companions are fighting the creature, your check automatically fails. If your check succeeds, the target is {@condition charmed} by you as long as it remains within 60 feet of you and for 1 minute thereafter.

feat.name: Divine Communications
entries: Your connection to your god deepens, granting you these benefits:

items.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Increase the ability score of the spellcasting ability chosen when you gained the Divinely Favored feat by 1, to a maximum of 20.

items.name: Celestial Tongues
entries: You learn to speak, read, and write Celestial, and two other languages of your choice.

items.name: Divine Omens
entries: You can cast the {@spell augury} and {@spell commune} spell without a spell slot, and you must finish {@dice 1d4} long rests before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell's spellcasting ability is the one chosen when you gained the Divinely Favored feat.

feat.name: Divinely Favored
entries: A god chose you to carry a spark of their power.

You learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter cleric spell list|spells|level=0|class=cleric} and one 1st-level spell based on the alignment of your character, as specified in the Alignment Spells table below. You also learn the {@spell augury} spell.

You can cast the chosen 1st-level spell and the {@spell augury} spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast either of these spells in this way again. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).
In addition, you can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses the spellcasting ability you choose when you select this feat.

feat.name: Divinely Favored
entries: A god has chosen you to carry a spark of their divine power.
You learn the {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip and one 1st-level spell based on the alignment of your character, as specified in the Alignment Spells table.
You can cast the chosen 1st-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).

entries.caption: Alignment Spells
rows: Choose one {@filter 1st-level druid or wizard spell|spells|level=1|class=wizard;druid}.

entries: In addition, you can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses the spellcasting ability you choose when you select this feat.

feat.name: Divinely Favored
entries: A god has chosen you to carry a spark of their divine power.

You learn one cantrip of your choice from the cleric spell list and one 1st-level spell based on the alignment of your character, as specified in the Alignment Spells table below. You also learn the {@spell augury} spell.

You can cast the chosen 1st-level spell and the {@spell augury} spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast either of these spells in this way again. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).
In addition, you can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses the spellcasting ability you choose when you select this feat.

feat.name: Dragon Fear
entries: When angered, you radiate menace. You gain the following benefits:

items: Instead of exhaling destructive energy, you can roar and expend a use of your breath weapon to force each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). A target automatically succeeds if it can't hear or see you. On a failed save, a target becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the {@condition frightened} target takes any damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

feat.name: Dragon Fear
entries: When angered, you radiate menace. You gain the following benefits:

items: Instead of exhaling destructive energy, you can expend a use of your Breath Weapon trait to roar, forcing each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). A target automatically succeeds on the save if it can't hear or see you. On a failed save, a target becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. If the {@condition frightened} target takes any damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

feat.name: Dragon Hide
entries: You inherited the might and majesty of your dragon ancestors. You gain the following benefits:

items: You grow retractable claws from the tips of your fingers. Extending or retracting the claws requires no action. The claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
Your scales harden; you gain a +1 bonus to AC while you aren't wearing armor.

feat.name: Dragon Hide
entries: You manifest scales and claws reminiscent of your draconic ancestors. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your scales harden. While you aren't wearing armor, you can calculate your AC as 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

You grow retractable claws from the tips of your fingers. Extending or retracting the claws requires no action. The claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike.

feat.name: Dragon Wings
entries: You sprout draconic wings. With your wings, you have a flying speed of 20 feet if you aren't wearing heavy armor and aren't exceeding your carrying capacity.

feat.name: Dragonmark of Detection
entries: You have the magical mark of Detection, the dragonmark of House Medani, and are a member of that house.

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell detect magic}, {@spell mage hand}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell detect thoughts}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell clairvoyance}

feat.name: Dragonmark of Finding
entries: You have the magical mark of Finding, the dragonmark of House Tharashk, and are a member of that house.

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell identify}, {@spell mage hand}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell locate object}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell clairvoyance}

feat.name: Dragonmark of Handling
entries: You have the magical mark of Handling, the dragonmark of House Vadalis, and are a member of that house.

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell druidcraft}, {@spell speak with animals}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell beast sense}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell conjure animals}

feat.name: Dragonmark of Healing

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell cure wounds}, {@spell spare the dying}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell lesser restoration}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell revivify}

feat.name: Dragonmark of Hospitality
entries: You have the magical mark of Hospitality, the dragonmark of House Ghallanda, and are a member of that house.

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Charisma as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell friends}, {@spell unseen servant}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell rope trick}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell Leomund's tiny hut}

feat.name: Dragonmark of Making
entries: You have the magical mark of Making, the dragonmark of House Cannith, and are a member of that house.

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell identify}, {@spell mending}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell magic weapon}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell fabricate}

feat.name: Dragonmark of Passage

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell expeditious retreat}, {@spell light}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell misty step}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell teleportation circle}

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell comprehend languages}, {@spell message}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell sending}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell tongues}

feat.name: Dragonmark of Sentinel

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell blade ward}, {@spell compelled duel}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell blur}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell protection from energy}

feat.name: Dragonmark of Shadow
entries: You have the magical mark of Shadow, the dragonmark of House Phiarlan and House Thuranni, and are a member of one of those houses.

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Charisma as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell dancing lights}, {@spell disguise self}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell darkness}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell nondetection}

feat.name: Dragonmark of Storm
entries: You have the magical mark of Storm, the dragonmark of House Lyrander, and are a member of that house.

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell fog cloud}, {@spell shocking grasp}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell gust of wind}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell sleet storm}

feat.name: Dragonmark of Warding
entries: You have the magical mark of Warding, the dragonmark of House Kundarak, and are a member of that house.

You gain the ability to innately cast spells and cantrips, using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. You cast each spell at its lowest level. Once you cast a given spell this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it innately again. You must still expend any material components. Your dragonmark confers the following benefits:

entries.name: Least Dragonmark
entries: When you first take this feat, you gain the least dragonmark. You learn the following spells: {@spell alarm}, {@spell resistance}

entries.name: Lesser Dragonmark
entries: At 5th level and higher, your mark becomes more potent, improving to lesser dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell arcane lock}

entries.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: At 9th level and higher, your mark's power increases again, becoming a greater dragonmark. You learn the following spell: {@spell magic circle}

feat.name: Drow High Magic
entries: You learn more of the spells typical for your people. You learn {@spell detect magic} and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn {@spell levitate} and {@spell dispel magic}, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast the spell in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Drow High Magic
entries: You learn more of the magic typical of dark elves. You learn the {@spell detect magic} spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn {@spell levitate} and {@spell dispel magic}, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast those two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

feat.name: Dual Wielder
entries: You master fighting with two weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand.
You can use two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed melee weapons you are wielding aren't light.
You can draw or stow two one-handed weapons when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

feat.name: Dungeon Delver
entries: Alert to the hidden traps and secret doors found in many dungeons, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks made to detect the presence of secret doors.
You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps.
You have resistance to the damage dealt by traps.
Traveling at a fast pace doesn't impose the normal -5 penalty on your passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score.

feat.name: Durable
entries: Hardy and resilient, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, the minimum number of hit points you regain from the roll equals twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 2).

feat.name: Dwarf Resilience
entries: You have the blood of dwarf heroes flowing through your veins. You gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you take the {@action Dodge} action in combat, you can spend one Hit Die to heal yourself. Roll the die, add your Constitution modifier, and regain a number of hit points equal to the total (minimum of 1).

feat.name: Dwarven Fortitude
entries: You have the blood of dwarf heroes flowing through your veins. You gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you take the {@action Dodge} action in combat, you can spend one Hit Die to heal yourself. Roll the die, add your Constitution modifier, and regain a number of hit points equal to the total (minimum of 1).

feat.name: Eldritch Adept
entries: Studying occult lore, you learn one {@filter Eldritch Invocation|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=EI} option of your choice from the warlock class. Your spellcasting ability for the invocation is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat). If the invocation has a prerequisite of any kind, you can choose that invocation only if you're a warlock who meets the prerequisite.
Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the invocation with another one from the warlock class.

feat.name: Eldritch Adept
entries: Studying occult lore, you have unlocked eldritch power within yourself: you learn one {@filter Eldritch Invocation|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=EI} option of your choice from the warlock class. If the invocation has a prerequisite, you can choose that invocation only if you're a warlock and only if you meet the prerequisite.
Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the invocation with another one from the warlock class.

feat.name: Elemental Adept
entries: When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.
Spells you cast ignore resistance to damage of the chosen type. In addition, when you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals damage of that type, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.
You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different damage type.

feat.name: Elemental Touched
entries: You've been exposed to the primordial magic of the Elemental Planes, granting you a measure of control over the natural world around you. You learn the either the druidcraft or {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip, using Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as the spellcasting ability (choose when you gain this feat).

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can choose which element you are attuned to: Air, Earth, Fire, or Water. Depending on your choice, you can use a bonus action to cause one of the following effects:

items.name: Air
entries: You gain a fly speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your turn. If you are airborne at the end of your turn after using this movement and aren't held aloft by other means, you fall.

items.name: Earth
entries: You cause the ground within 30 feet of you to become {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for 1 minute or until you create this effect again. During that time, you can move across ground that is {@quickref difficult terrain||3} without spending extra movement.

items.name: Fire
entries: You surround yourself in a cloud of ash and smoke. Until the end of your turn, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

items.name: Water
entries: You can create a forceful surge of water directed at a creature within 15 feet of you that you can see. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw (which it can choose to fail) against a DC equal to 8 + your spellcasting ability modifier + your proficiency bonus or be pushed up to 10 feet away from you. The water vanishes immediately after the creature succeeds or fails.
You can create this effect a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Elven Accuracy
entries: You have uncanny aim. You gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you have advantage on an attack roll, you can reroll one of the dice once.

feat.name: Elven Accuracy
entries: The accuracy of elves is legendary, especially that of elf archers and spellcasters. You have uncanny aim with attacks that rely on precision rather than brute force. You gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you have advantage on an attack roll using Dexterity, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, you can reroll one of the dice once.

feat.name: Ember of the Fire Giant

feat: strike of the giants|BGG|strike of the giants (fire strike)

entries: You've manifested the fiery combat emblematic of fire giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Born of Flame
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

items.name: Searing Ignition
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace a single attack with a magical burst of flame. Each creature of your choice in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, a creature takes fire damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your proficiency bonus, and it has the blinded condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. You can use your Searing Ignition a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus (but no more than once per turn), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Ember of the Fire Giant
entries: You've manifested the fiery combat emblematic of fire giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Born of Flame
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

items.name: Searing Ignition
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a magical burst of flame. Each creature of your choice within 15 feet of you that can see you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, a creature takes fire damage equal to {@dice 2d6} + your proficiency bonus and is {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn; on a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects. You can use your Searing Ignition a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Ember Of The Fire Giant

feat: strike of the giants|ua2022wondersofthemultiverse|strike of the giants (fire giant)

entries: You've manifested the fiery combat emblematic of fire giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Born of Flame
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

items.name: Searing Ignition
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace a single attack with a magical burst of flame. Each creature of your choice within 15 feet of you that can see you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, a creature takes fire damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your proficiency bonus, and it is {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}. You can use your Searing Ignition a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Empathic
entries: You possess keen insight into how other people think and feel. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Insight} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

You can use your action to try to get uncanny insight about one humanoid you can see within 30 feet of you. Make a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check contested by the target's Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check. If your check succeeds, you have advantage on attack rolls and ability checks against the target until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Everybody's Friend
entries: You develop your magnetic personality to ease your way through the world. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception} and {@skill Persuasion} skills. If you're already proficient in either skill, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with that skill.

feat.name: Fade Away
entries: You can draw on your magical heritage to escape danger. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you take damage, you can use a reaction to magically become {@condition invisible} until the end of your next turn or until you attack, deal damage, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Fade Away
entries: Your people are clever, with a knack for illusion magic. You have learned a magical trick for fading away when you suffer harm. You gain the following benefits:

items: Immediately after you take damage, you can use a reaction to magically become {@condition invisible} until the end of your next turn or until you attack, deal damage, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Fell Handed
entries: You master the {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item greataxe|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item maul|phb}. You gain the following benefits when using any of them:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls you make with the weapon.
Whenever you have advantage on a melee attack roll you make with the weapon and hit, you can knock the target {@condition prone} if the lower of the two {@dice d20} rolls would also hit the target.

Whenever you have disadvantage on a melee attack roll you make with the weapon, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but the higher of the two {@dice d20} rolls would have hit.

If you use the {@action Help} action to aid an ally's melee attack while you're wielding the weapon, you knock the target's shield aside momentarily. In addition to the ally gaining advantage on the attack roll, the ally gains a +2 bonus to the roll if the target is using a shield.

feat.name: Fey Teleportation
entries: Drawing on your fey ancestry, you have learned how to teleport. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell misty step} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a short or long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Fey Teleportation
entries: Your study of high elven lore has unlocked fey power that few other elves possess, except your eladrin cousins. Drawing on your fey ancestry, you can momentarily stride through the Feywild to shorten your path from one place to another. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn to speak, read, and write {@language Sylvan}.

You learn the {@spell misty step} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a short or long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Fey Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell misty step} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=E;D} of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=E;D} must be from the divination or enchantment school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Fey Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Feywild or one of its denizens has left a magical mark on you. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell misty step} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=E;D} of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=E;D} must be from the divination or enchantment school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Fighting Initiate
entries: Your martial training has helped you develop a particular style of fighting. As a result, you learn one {@filter Fighting Style|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=FS:F} option of your choice from the fighter class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different.
Whenever you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace this feat's fighting style with another one from the fighter class that you don't have.

feat.name: Fighting Initiate
entries: Your martial training has helped you develop a particular style of fighting. As a result, you learn one {@filter Fighting Style|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=FS:F} option of your choice from the fighter class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different.
Whenever you gain a level, you can replace this feat's fighting style with another one from the fighter class that you don't have.

feat.name: Flail Mastery
entries: The {@item flail|phb} is a tricky weapon to use, but you have spent countless hours mastering it. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls you make with a flail.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can prepare yourself to extend your flail to sweep over targets' {@item shield|phb|shields}. Until the end of this turn, your attack rolls with a flail gain a +2 bonus against any target using a {@item shield|phb}.
When you hit with an opportunity attack using a flail, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

feat.name: Flames of Phlegethos
entries: You learn to call on hellfire to serve your commands. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you roll fire damage for a spell you cast, you can reroll any roll of 1 on the fire damage dice, but you must use the new roll, even if it is another 1.

Whenever you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can cause flames to wreathe you until the end of your next turn. The flames don't harm you or your possessions, and they shed bright light out to 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet. While the flames are present, any creature within 5 feet of you that hits you with a melee attack takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage.

feat.name: Flames of Phlegethos
entries: You learn to call on hellfire to serve your commands. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you roll fire damage for a spell you cast, you can reroll any roll of 1 on the fire damage dice, but you must use the new roll, even if it is another 1.

Whenever you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can cause flames to wreathe you until the end of your next turn. The flames don't harm you or your possessions, and they shed bright light out to 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet. While the flames are present, any creature within 5 feet of you that hits you with a melee attack takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage.

feat.name: Flash Recall
entries: You've developed the ability to instantly recall an unprepared spell in moments of sudden necessity.

As a bonus action, you prepare a spell of 1st level or higher from your spellbook (if you're a {@class wizard}) or from your class spell list (if you're not a {@class wizard}). This spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it replaces another spell of an equal or higher level that you had previously prepared.
Once you use this feat to recall a spell, you can't do so again until you complete a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|short or long rest}.

entries.name: Rules Tip: Prepared Spells
entries: The Flash Recall feat requires you to be a spellcaster who prepares spells. This includes classes such as {@class cleric||clerics}, {@class druid||druids}, and {@class paladin||paladins}, who prepare spells each day from their class list, and {@class wizard||wizards}, who prepare spells from a spellbook. Classes such as {@class bard||bards} and {@class sorcerer||sorcerers}, who inherently know their spells rather than preparing them, can't benefit from this feat.

feat.name: Fury of the Frost Giant

feat: strike of the giants|BGG|strike of the giants (frost strike)

entries: You've manifested the icy might emblematic of frost giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Born of Ice
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

items.name: Frigid Retaliation
entries: Immediately after a creature you can see within 30 feet of you hits you with an attack roll and deals damage, you can use your reaction to retaliate with a conjured blast of ice. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature takes cold damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your proficiency bonus, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Fury of the Frost Giant
entries: You've manifested the icy might emblematic of frost giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Born of Ice
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

items.name: Frigid Vengeance
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to retaliate with a burst of magical ire. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or be {@condition frightened} of you until the start of its next turn. You can use your reaction in this way a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Fury Of The Frost Giant

feat: strike of the giants|ua2022wondersofthemultiverse|strike of the giants (frost giant)

entries: You've manifested the icy might emblematic of frost giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Born of Ice
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

items.name: Frigid Retaliation
entries: Immediately after a creature you can see within 30 feet of you hits you with an attack roll and deals damage, you can use your reaction to retaliate with a conjured blast of ice. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d8} + your proficiency bonus cold damage, and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Chromatic Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of chromatic dragons, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Chromatic Infusion
entries: As a bonus action, you can touch a {@filter simple or martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;simple weapon} and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the chosen type when it hits. After you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Reactive Resistance
entries: When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that instance of damage. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Chromatic Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of chromatic dragons, granting you the following benefits:

items: As a bonus action, you can touch a {@filter simple or martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;simple weapon} and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d4} damage of the chosen type when it hits. After you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that instance of damage. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Gem Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of gem dragons, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Telekinetic Reprisal
entries: When you take damage from a creature that is within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to emanate telekinetic energy. The creature that dealt damage to you must make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Gem Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of gem dragons, granting you the following benefits:

items: When you take damage from a creature that is within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to emanate telekinetic energy. The creature that dealt damage to you must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat) or take {@dice 2d8} force damage and be pushed 10 feet away from you. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Metallic Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of metallic dragons, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Draconic Healing
entries: You learn the {@spell cure wounds} spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have. The spell's spellcasting ability is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma when you cast it with this feat (choose when you gain the feat).

items.name: Protective Wings
entries: You can manifest protective wings that can shield you or others. When you or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to manifest spectral wings from your back for a moment. You grant a bonus to the target's AC equal to your proficiency bonus against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Metallic Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of metallic dragons, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell cure wounds} spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have. The spell's spellcasting ability is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma when you cast it with this feat (choose when you gain this feat).

You can manifest protective wings that can shield you or others from attacks. When you or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to manifest spectral wings from your back for a moment. Roll a {@dice d4} and grant a bonus to the target's AC equal to the number rolled against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gourmand
entries: You have mastered a variety of special recipes, allowing you to prepare exotic dishes with useful effects. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with {@item cook's utensils|phb}. If you are already proficient with them, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with them.
As an action, you can inspect a drink or plate of food within 5 feet of you and determine whether it is {@condition poisoned}, provided that you can see and smell it.

During a long rest, you can prepare and serve a meal that helps you and your allies recover from the rigors of adventuring, provided you have suitable food, {@item cook's utensils|phb}, and other supplies on hand. The meal serves up to six people, and each person who eats it regains two additional Hit Dice at the end of the long rest. In addition, those who partake of the meal have advantage on Constitution saving throws against disease for the next 24 hours.

feat.name: Grappler
entries: You've developed the skills necessary to hold your own in close-quarters grappling. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are grappling.

You can use your action to try to pin a creature {@condition grappled} by you. To do so, make another grapple check. If you succeed, you and the creature are both {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends.

feat.name: Great Weapon Master
entries: You've learned to put the weight of a weapon to your advantage, letting its momentum empower your strikes. You gain the following benefits:

items: On your turn, when you score a critical hit with a melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, you can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action.
Before you make a melee attack with a heavy weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

feat.name: Grudge-Bearer
entries: You have a deep hatred for a particular kind of creature. Choose your foes, a type of creature to bear the burden of your wrath: aberrations, beasts, celestials, constructs, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, giants, monstrosities, oozes, plants, or undead. Alternatively, you can choose two races of humanoid (such as gnolls and orcs). You gain the following benefits:

items: During the first round of any combat against your chosen foes, your attack rolls against any of them have advantage.
When any of your chosen foes makes an opportunity attack against you, it makes the attack roll with disadvantage.

Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}) check to recall information about your chosen foes, you add double your proficiency bonus to the check, even if you're not normally proficient.

feat.name: Guile of the Cloud Giant

feat: strike of the giants|BGG|strike of the giants (cloud strike)

entries: You've manifested the confounding magic emblematic of cloud giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Cloudy Escape
entries: When a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that attack's damage. You then teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Guile of the Cloud Giant
entries: You've manifested the airy speech and magic emblematic of cloud giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Misty Form
entries: You can cast the {@spell blur} spell without using a spell slot or material components. When you cast the spell in this way, the spell doesn't require you to maintain {@status concentration} on it. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell in the normal way using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feature (choose when you gain this feat).

items.name: Silver Tongue
entries: You gain proficiency in either the {@skill Deception} or {@skill Persuasion} skill. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make using this skill.

feat.name: Guile Of The Cloud Giant

feat: strike of the giants|ua2022wondersofthemultiverse|strike of the giants (cloud giant)

entries: You've manifested the airy speech and magic emblematic of cloud giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Cloudy Escape
entries: When a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that attack's damage. You then teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gunner
entries: You have a quick hand and keen eye when employing firearms, granting you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with firearms (see "{@variantrule Firearms|DMG}" in the Dungeon Master's Guide).
You ignore the loading property of firearms.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

feat.name: Gunner
entries: You have a quick hand and keen eye when employing firearms, granting you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with firearms (see "{@variantrule Firearms|DMG}" in the Dungeon Master's Guide).
You ignore the loading property of firearms.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

feat.name: Healer
entries: You are an able physician, allowing you to mend wounds quickly and get your allies back in the fight. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you use a {@item healer's kit|phb} to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains 1 hit point.

As an action, you can spend one use of a {@item healer's kit|phb} to tend to a creature and restore {@dice 1d6 + 4} hit points to it, plus additional hit points equal to the creature's maximum number of Hit Dice. The creature can't regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest.

feat.name: Heavily Armored
entries: You have trained to master the use of heavy armor, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with heavy armor.

feat.name: Heavy Armor Master
entries: You can use your armor to deflect strikes that would kill others. You gain the following benefits:

items: While you are wearing heavy armor, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from nonmagical attacks is reduced by 3.

feat.name: Historian
entries: Your study of history rewards you with the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill History} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

When you take the {@action Help} action to aid another creature's ability check, you can make a DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill History}) check. On a success, that creature's check gains a bonus equal to your proficiency bonus, as you share pertinent advice and historical examples. To receive this bonus, the creature must be able to understand what you're saying.

feat.name: Human Determination
entries: You are filled with a determination that can draw the unreachable within your reach. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can do so with advantage. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Infernal Constitution
entries: Fiendish blood runs strong in you. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to cold and poison damage.
You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

feat.name: Infernal Constitution
entries: Fiendish blood runs strong in you, unlocking a resilience akin to that possessed by some fiends. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to cold and poison damage.
You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

feat.name: Initiate of High Sorcery
entries: You've received training from magic-users affiliated with the Mages of High Sorcery.

Choose one of the three moons of Krynn to influence your magic: the black moon, Nuitari; the red moon, Lunitari; or the white moon, Solinari. You learn one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list and two 1st-level spells based on the moon you choose, as specified in the Lunar Spells table.

entries.caption: Lunar Spells
rows: Choose two from {@spell dissonant whispers}, {@spell false life}, {@spell hex}, and {@spell ray of sickness}
Choose two from {@spell color spray}, {@spell disguise self}, {@spell feather fall}, and {@spell longstrider}
Choose two from {@spell comprehend languages}, {@spell detect evil and good}, {@spell protection from evil and good}, and {@spell shield}

entries: You can cast each of the chosen 1st-level spells without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast them in this way again. You can also cast the spells using any spell slots you have.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).

feat.name: Initiate of High Sorcery
entries: You've received training from magic-users affiliated with the Mages of High Sorcery. Choose one of the three moons of Krynn, each of which is associated with a distinct type of magic: the black moon, Nuitari; the red moon, Lunitari; or the white moon Solinari. You learn one cantrip and one 1st-level spell based on the moon you choose, as specified in the Lunar Spells table.
You can cast the chosen 1st-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).

entries.caption: Lunar Spells
rows: Choose one from {@spell chill touch}, {@spell mage hand}, and {@spell vicious mockery}
Choose one {@filter 1st-level wizard spell from the evocation or necromancy school of magic|spells|level=1|class=wizard|school=V;N}.
Choose one from {@spell guidance}, {@spell message}, and {@spell prestidigitation}
Choose one {@filter 1st-level wizard spell from the school of divination or transmutation|spells|level=1|class=wizard|school=D;T}.
Choose one from {@spell produce flame}, {@spell resistance}, and {@spell spare the dying}
Choose one {@filter 1st-level wizard spell from the abjuration or conjuration school of magic|spells|level=1|class=wizard|school=A;C}.

feat.name: Initiate of High Sorcery
entries: You've received training from magic-users affiliated with the Mages of High Sorcery.

Choose one of the three moons of Krynn to influence your magic: the black moon, Nuitari; the red moon, Lunitari; or the white moon Solinari. You learn one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list and two 1st-level spells based on the moon you choose, as specified in the Lunar Spells table.

You can cast each of the chosen 1st-level spells without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spells using any spell slots you have.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).

entries.caption: Lunar Spells
rows: Choose two from {@spell dissonant whispers}, {@spell false life}, {@spell hex}, and {@spell ray of sickness}.
Choose two from {@spell color spray}, {@spell disguise self}, {@spell feather fall}, and {@spell longstrider}.
Choose two from {@spell comprehend languages}, {@spell detect evil and good}, {@spell protection from evil and good}, and {@spell shield}.

feat.name: Inspiring Leader
entries: You can spend 10 minutes inspiring your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight. When you do so, choose up to six friendly creatures (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each creature can gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier. A creature can't gain temporary hit points from this feat again until it has finished a short or long rest.

feat.name: Investigator
entries: You have an eye for detail and can pick out the smallest clues. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Investigation} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
You can take the {@action Search} action as a bonus action.

feat.name: Keen Mind
entries: You have a mind that can track time, direction, and detail with uncanny precision. You gain the following benefits:

items: You always know which way is north.
You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset.
You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month.

feat.name: Keenness of the Stone Giant

feat: strike of the giants|BGG|strike of the giants (stone strike)

entries: You've manifested the physical talents emblematic of stone giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Cavernous Sight
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision} from another source, its range increases by 60 feet.

items.name: Stone Throw
entries: As a bonus action, you can take a rock and make a magical attack with it. The attack is a ranged spell attack with a range of 60 feet that uses the ability score you increased with this feat as the spellcasting ability. On a hit, the rock deals {@damage 1d10} force damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the spellcasting ability modifier) or have the prone condition. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Keenness of the Stone Giant
entries: You've manifested the protection and spellcasting emblematic of stone giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Dreamer's Magic
entries: You learn the {@spell detect thoughts} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=A;D} of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the abjuration or the divination school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feature (choose when you gain this feat).

items.name: Mountain Sight
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision} from another source, its range increases by 30 feet.

feat.name: Keenness Of The Stone Giant

feat: strike of the giants|ua2022wondersofthemultiverse|strike of the giants (stone giant)

entries: You've manifested the physical talents emblematic of stone giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Stone Throw
entries: As a bonus action, you can touch a rock that can fit in the palm of your hand and imbue it with magic. While the rock is imbued with magic and you are wielding it, the rock is a magic ranged weapon with which you're proficient, and it has the thrown property with a normal range of 60 feet and a long range of 180 feet. On a hit, the rock deals {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat) or be knocked {@condition prone}. The magic remains in the rock until you hit with it or finish a long rest. You can imbue a number of rocks equal to your proficiency bonus with this bonus action, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Cavernous Sight
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision} from another source, its range increases by 60 feet.

feat.name: Knight of the Crown
entries: You are a Knight of Solamnia aligned with the Order of the Crown, a group that extols the virtues of cooperation, loyalty, and obedience. You excel in group combat and gain these benefits:

items.name: Commanding Rally
entries: As a bonus action, you can command one ally within 30 feet of yourself to attack. If that ally can see or hear you, they can immediately make one weapon attack as a reaction. If the attack hits, the ally can roll a {@dice d8} and add the number rolled as a bonus to the attack's damage roll. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Membership in Knightly Orders
entries: Knights of Solamnia are only ever members of one of their organization's orders. In the course of their training, most knights begin as members of the Knights of the Crown and then move on to join other orders. Whether a character follows this path or another, they retain what they learned as a member of an order even if they join another. Characters can change what knightly order they're a part of, but they always have access to any Knight of Solamnia feats they've acquired.

feat.name: Knight of the Crown
entries: You are a Knight of Solamnia aligned with the Order of the Crown, a group that extols the virtues of cooperation, loyalty, and obedience. You excel in group combat and gain these benefits:

items.name: Tactical Teamwork
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll against another creature that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to grant advantage on the attack roll. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Membership in Multiple Knightly Orders
entries: Knights of Solamnia are only ever members of one of their organization's orders. In the course of their training, most knights begin as members of the Knights of the Crown and then move on to join other orders. Whether a character follows this path or another, they retain what they learned as a member of an order even if they join another. Characters can change what knightly order they're a part of, but they always have access to any Knight of Solamnia feats they've acquired.

feat.name: Knight of the Crown
entries: You are a Knight of Solamnia aligned with the Order of the Crown, a group that extols the virtues of cooperation, loyalty, and obedience. You excel in group combat and gain these benefits:

items.name: Crown Maneuvers
entries: You learn the {@optfeature Distracting Strike} or the {@optfeature Goading Attack} maneuver from the Battle Master subclass of the fighter in the Player's Handbook (choose the maneuver when you gain this feat). If the maneuver requires a saving throw, the save's DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). Whenever you finish a long rest, you can replace the maneuver you learned from this feat with the other maneuver offered by it.

items.name: Superiority Dice
